required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy of a Dentifrice in Providing Relief From the Pain of Dentinal Hypersensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study Investigating the Efficacy of a Dentifrice in Providing Long Term Relief From Dentinal Hypersensitivity

brief_summary.textblock: A study to compare the efficacy of a test dentifrice against a control dentifrice in reducing dentinal hypersensitivity over an eight week treatment period.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Evaporative Air Sensitivity Pain Response on a Schiff Sensitivity Scale at Week 8
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 8 weeks post administration of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Response to a constant jet of air applied to hypersensitive teeth is evaluated using a Schiff Sensitivity pain response scale. According to this analog scale, pain response for each individual stimulated tooth ranged from 0 to 3; 0 - participant does not respond to air stimulation, 1 - participant responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus, 2 - participant responds to air stimulus and request discontinuation of stimulus, 3 - participant responds to air stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful and request discontinuation of stimulus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Evaporative Air Sensitivity Pain Response on a Schiff Sensitivity Scale at Week 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 4 weeks post administration of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Response to a constant jet of air applied to hypersensitive teeth was evaluated using a Schiff Sensitivity pain response scale. According to this analog scale, pain response for each individual stimulated tooth ranged from 0 to 3; 0 - participant does not respond to air stimulation, 1 - participant responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus, 2 - participant responds to air stimulus and request discontinuation of stimulus, 3 - participant responds to air stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful and request discontinuation of stimulus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Tactile Sensitivity Pain Response at Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 8 weeks post administration of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Response to increasing force on hypersensitive teeth was evaluated using a Yeaple Probe pain response scale. The constant pressure probe allowed the examiner to vary the force applied to the dentin surface from 10 grams (g) to an upper threshold of 80 g, in increments of 10g since the values below represents adjusted mean change in baseline, the value can fall below scale range. The greater the pressure the subject was able to tolerate, the less. Change from baseline in tactile response to Week 8 was calculated. sensitive the tooth. According to this tactile sensitivity assessment, an increasing force was applied to hypersensitive tooth until a yes response is recorded or the maximum force has been reached.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Tactile Sensitivity Pain Response at Week 4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 4 weeks post administration of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Response to increasing force on hypersensitive teeth was evaluated using a Yeaple Probe pain response scale. The constant pressure probe allowed the examiner to vary the force applied to the dentin surface from 10g to an upper threshold of 80g, in increments of 10g. The greater the pressure the subject was able to tolerate, the less sensitive the tooth. According to this tactile sensitivity assessment, an increasing force was applied to hypersensitive tooth until a yes response is recorded or the maximum force has been reached. Change from baseline in tactile response to Week 4 was calculated

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who suffer from tooth sensitivity
Inclusion Criteria:
- none

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 122 participants screened, 2 participants did not meet the study criteria, and 2 withdrew consent before randomization. 118 participants were randomized to study treatments.

group.title: Stannous Fluoride (SnF) Dentifrice
group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the test dentifrice 0.454% SnF for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 milliliter (mL) of water.

group.title: Sodium Monofluorophosphate (NaMFP) Dentifrice
group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the control dentifrice (0.76% NaMFP) for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 mL of water.

group.title: SnF Dentifrice
group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the test dentifrice containing 0.454% SnF for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 mL of water.

group.title: NaMFP Dentifrice
group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the control dentifrice containing 0.76% NaMFP for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 mL of water.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Evaporative Air Sensitivity Pain Response on a Schiff Sensitivity Scale at Week 8
outcome.description: Response to a constant jet of air applied to hypersensitive teeth is evaluated using a Schiff Sensitivity pain response scale. According to this analog scale, pain response for each individual stimulated tooth ranged from 0 to 3; 0 - participant does not respond to air stimulation, 1 - participant responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus, 2 - participant responds to air stimulus and request discontinuation of stimulus, 3 - participant responds to air stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful and request discontinuation of stimulus.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 8 weeks post administration of study treatment
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) Population: All randomized participants, who were administered with at least one study treatment during the study and provided at least one post-baseline assessment of efficacy. Missing values were not imputed.

group.title: SnF Dentifrice
group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the test dentifrice containing 0.454% SnF for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 mL of water.

group.title: NaMFP Dentifrice
group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the control dentifrice containing 0.76% NaMFP for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 mL of water.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Evaporative Air Sensitivity Pain Response on a Schiff Sensitivity Scale at Week 8
measure.description: Response to a constant jet of air applied to hypersensitive teeth is evaluated using a Schiff Sensitivity pain response scale. According to this analog scale, pain response for each individual stimulated tooth ranged from 0 to 3; 0 - participant does not respond to air stimulation, 1 - participant responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus, 2 - participant responds to air stimulus and request discontinuation of stimulus, 3 - participant responds to air stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful and request discontinuation of stimulus.
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) Population: All randomized participants, who were administered with at least one study treatment during the study and provided at least one post-baseline assessment of efficacy. Missing values were not imputed.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered change from baseline to be same for both treatments.
analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustment made for multiple comparisons, as primary comparison was pre-specified.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with treatment as fixed factor and baseline Schiff Score as covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is 0.454% SnF minus 0.76% NaMFP such that a negative difference favours first named treatment.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Evaporative Air Sensitivity Pain Response on a Schiff Sensitivity Scale at Week 4
outcome.description: Response to a constant jet of air applied to hypersensitive teeth was evaluated using a Schiff Sensitivity pain response scale. According to this analog scale, pain response for each individual stimulated tooth ranged from 0 to 3; 0 - participant does not respond to air stimulation, 1 - participant responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus, 2 - participant responds to air stimulus and request discontinuation of stimulus, 3 - participant responds to air stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful and request discontinuation of stimulus.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 4 weeks post administration of study treatment
outcome.population: ITT Population: All randomized participants, who were administered with at least one study treatment during the study and provided at least one post-baseline assessment of efficacy. Missing values were not imputed.

group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the test dentifrice containing 0.454% SnF for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 mL of water.

measure.description: Response to a constant jet of air applied to hypersensitive teeth was evaluated using a Schiff Sensitivity pain response scale. According to this analog scale, pain response for each individual stimulated tooth ranged from 0 to 3; 0 - participant does not respond to air stimulation, 1 - participant responds to air stimulus but does not request discontinuation of stimulus, 2 - participant responds to air stimulus and request discontinuation of stimulus, 3 - participant responds to air stimulus, considers stimulus to be painful and request discontinuation of stimulus.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered change from baseline to be same for both treatments.
analysis.p_value_desc: No adjustment made for multiple comparisons, as primary comparison was pre-specified.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with treatment as fixed factor and baseline Schiff Score as covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is 0.454% SnF minus 0.76% NaMFP such that a negative difference favours first named treatment.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Tactile Sensitivity Pain Response at Week 8
outcome.description: Response to increasing force on hypersensitive teeth was evaluated using a Yeaple Probe pain response scale. The constant pressure probe allowed the examiner to vary the force applied to the dentin surface from 10 grams (g) to an upper threshold of 80 g, in increments of 10g since the values below represents adjusted mean change in baseline, the value can fall below scale range. The greater the pressure the subject was able to tolerate, the less. Change from baseline in tactile response to Week 8 was calculated. sensitive the tooth. According to this tactile sensitivity assessment, an increasing force was applied to hypersensitive tooth until a yes response is recorded or the maximum force has been reached.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 8 weeks post administration of study treatment
outcome.population: ITT Population: All randomized participants, who were administered with at least one study treatment during the study and provided at least one post-baseline assessment of efficacy. Missing values were not imputed.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with treatment as fixed factor and baseline Schiff Score as covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is 0.454% SnF minus 0.76% NaMFP such that a positive difference favours first named treatment.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events encountered or spontaneously reported following administration of any investigational product, or for up to 5 days after the last administration of investigational product were recorded.

group.title: SnF Dentifrice
group.description: Participants brushed whole mouth with 1-inch strip of the test dentifrice containing 0.454% SnF for one timed minute, ensuring that they brushed all sensitive areas of their teeth. This was followed by rinsing with 5 mL of water.

group.title: NaMFP Dentifrice

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
